intro: Robertsonia dentata, commonly known as the toothed Robertsonia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive toothed margin, contributing to its common name. Robertsonia dentata typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks.
